text: well what worries you most about the
conditions of this complacency that
people at large generally they don't
understand that our lives depend on
maintaining the planet pretty much the
way it was when we came along 10,000 or
100,000 however long ago you want to
trace our history that's certainly the
world is not what it used to me I tell
people I come from a different planet
and they say young we knew that but it's
the planet I knew as a kid really has
changed we've seen more change to the
natural world in the last century the
last half century and even in the last
10 years the pace is picking up at a
rate that is unprecedented in all of
human history we have the technological
capacity to destroy to unravel the
systems that have taken all preceding
history to put the planet that works in
our favor and we have undone it or at
least we're well along the way to
undoing it we are changing the nature of
nature but I think not too late to turn
it around you know imagine it trying to
have seven billion people thrive on Mars
there's a great example of earth without
nature without them this specific make
our lives possible if you haven't seen
the Martian check it out you know you
know where air comes from well the
Martian antav science tit figure out how
to make a hair out of rocks how to find
make food out of a handful of potatoes
and you know it's just we take
everything for granted and we think
earth is too big to fail and I think
10,000 years ago in 1,000 years ago even
50 years ago people maybe
some justification for thinking that no
matter what we do earth will continue to
go on and be okay for us but we already
had plenty of both signals half a
century ago that should have awakened us
to the need for us to take care of that
which keeps us alive our life-support
system that is built in on this planet
but nowhere else in the universe could
we count on having such gifts ready made
for us and for all the rest of life
